title: Gorillas Rotkohl
description: Grocery delivery services are booming and they all only talk about one thing: speed. With a different approach, a very slow one, Gorillas serves up an arthouse short film called Red Cabbage on YouTube that is about as long as the Gorillas delivery time: 8 minutes.
description2: Red Cabbage tells the story of Rod Kohl, who gets forgotten on a night bus and meets all sorts of strangers. He takes the audience into a cosmos that is very popular with the young target group and in which time doesn't matter: the Berlin night.

title: BMW
description: Our campaign for the 2 Series Active Tourer is a testament to adaptability, mirroring the versatility of life itself. With a plug-and-play production approach, we created a multitude of adaptations, each tailored to different markets, target audiences, and customer journey stages.
Despite it being a product launch campaign, we didn’t focus only on technical features but on what they can do for you. With many small stories, all coming from A TOUR CALLED LIFE.

title: Adidas Uniforia
description: The Adidas Uniforia Pack SS20 project developed a visual language inspired by the principles of arts and crafts. The collection’s unique design elements featured handcrafted paint strokes, digitized through a blend of analogue and digital techniques, reflecting the raw, imperfect beauty found in both sports and art
The retail concept was transformed into a flexible global toolkit catering different global market realities. From small scale to flagship executions.

title: Gorillas eoy
description: Winter 2021, grocery delivery in minutes became the new thing. And since everyone had the same exact focus, Gorillas needed to stand out by focusing on something else: empathy. This story was told across all channels and touch points. Using real human insights, that spoke to all of our target groups, no matter where they were celebrating the holidays.

title: Tinder
description: The idea of finding "the one" is a socially romanticized view of relationships. Tinder aims to shift this perspective by suggesting that there isn't just one perfect match for each of us; instead, anyone could be "the one" — whether they are the funny one, the attractive one, or the intelligent one.
To illustrate this, we imagined a Waldo puzzle made entirely of Waldos, symbolizing how effortlessly you can find not just one, but many perfect matches.

title: Bundesliga
description: At the top of the German football league, the Bundesliga is Germany's primary football competition. For its season finale, we were in charge of making a design toolkit, to be used across Bundesliga digital media and Tv channels.
